concept_definition: Having the shape of a square; having four equal straight sides and four right angles.
rectangular; having the shape of a rectangle â€” a four-sided plane figure with four right angles and opposite sides equal in length
Having the shape of a triangle; consisting of or forming three angles or three sides.
Shaped like an elongated circle; having a rounded outline resembling an egg.
having the shape of a cube; three-dimensional and bounded by six equal square faces
shaped like a sphere; having the form of a round three-dimensional ball
shaped like a cylinder; having the form of a solid or hollow object with straight parallel sides and circular ends (e.g., cylindrical)
shaped like a cone; having the form of a three-dimensional figure with a circular base that tapers to a point (e.g., cone-shaped)
Having the shape of a pyramid; relating to or resembling a pyramid.
Having six angles and six sides; shaped like a hexagon (also used attributively, e.g., hexagon tile).
pentagon (noun): a plane figure with five straight sides and five angles.
having eight sides and eight angles; of, relating to, or shaped like an octagon
